visualization_prompt: Generate a layered map visualization showing South Korean domestic flight route connectivity using Highmaps with (1) base geographical context, (2) airport location markers color-coded by flight traffic tiers, and (3) curved connection lines between major hubs

visualization_code.CSS:
#container { height: 680px; min-width: 310px; max-width: 800px; margin: 0 auto; }
.loading { margin-top: 10em; text-align: center; color: gray; }

visualization_explanation:
The dataset contains three-dimensional geospatial data: 1) Polygon geometries for South Korea's administrative boundaries, 2) Point coordinates for airports with categorical traffic tier classifications, and 3) Great-circle route connections between major hubs. Synthetic flight paths follow realistic aviation routing patterns with curvature calculated via quadratic Bézier interpolation.

The base map provides essential spatial context while minimizing visual clutter through subtle nullColor shading. Airport markers employ Cairo's preattentive processing principles using color intensity (red→yellow→green) to denote flight frequency tiers. Curved connection lines reduce overlapping compared to straight lines, adhering to Tufte's data-ink maximization by removing unnecessary map details. Traffic tiers follow synthetic Poisson distributions (λ=15 daily flights for red hubs, λ=7 for yellow, λ=3 for green) mimicking real-world airport capacity hierarchies.
